column4: Hi. I am completely new to Beryl and have some questions. I am trying to install Beryl properly and apparently I need to do the following: "To start with beryl automatically we need to create a session shell script. In your text editor, I use vim, create a new script named start-beryl.sh (running as root)"   I have downloaded vim and installed it, but where is it??? I've looked in applications, etc. It isn't there... Also, h
ow do I login as root, and how do I know if I am logged in as root or not?:
instead of logging as root you use sudo... vim is console text editor, you can use anything else, you run it by typing 'vim'
